Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the nature of the executive order by stating that President Trump has already signed it, when in fact, it was only a leaked draft at the time.
Understate: The claim understates the existing laws that already make undocumented immigrants ineligible for public benefits.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that President Trump has signed an executive order barring undocumented people from receiving welfare.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that undocumented immigrants are collecting welfare, without providing evidence or data to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the leaked draft, such as it being a proposal or a discussion document rather than a fully-fledged signed order.
